The Special Collections Department 9866-d

defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Katie Letcher Lyle Papers, 1908-1986, Accession #9866-d , Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was a gift from Katie Letcher Lyle, Lexington, Virginia, on August 14, 1986.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Katie Letcher Lyle is an American author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains drafts, research material, correspondence, illustrations, and some copyright and financial material for two of Lyle's books: Scalded to Death by the Steam: Authentic Stories of Railroad Disasters and the Ballads That Were Written About Themand The Man Who Wanted Seven Wives: Being the Account of a Famous Murder Mystery of 1897 Supposedly Solved by the Testimony of a Ghost, Together with an Explanation of the Same.
